deleted_lines: pool.spawn_n(self.safe_configure_dhcp_for_network, network)

subject: Update tox.ini to use new features
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-09 12:57:35.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/0bccbf33790ac3c5ecfba61706be16f20776908e', 'message': "Update tox.ini to use new features

tox 1.6 allows us to skip the sdist step, which is slow. This does that.
It also allows us to override the install line. In this case, it's
important as it allows us to stop getting pre-release software we
weren't asking for.

Original patch by Monty Taylor, talked about here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-September/015495.html

Change-Id: I9fe8a6cff149b3b79d434dc955c77a358c43031d
"}]
commit_message:
Update tox.ini to use new features

tox 1.6 allows us to skip the sdist step, which is slow. This does that.
It also allows us to override the install line. In this case, it's
important as it allows us to stop getting pre-release software we
weren't asking for.

Original patch by Monty Taylor, talked about here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-September/015495.html

Change-Id: I9fe8a6cff149b3b79d434dc955c77a358c43031d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/03/60803/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: minversion = 1.6 skipsdist = Trueusedevelop = True install_command = pip install {opts} {packages}

commit_message:
Add support for network name for os::nova::Server

Property 'network' is added to networks schema of the resource
os::nova::Server. It takes uuid or name. The 'uuid' property is deprecated.

Change-Id: I790bd23301ecfb7b8aa22f6c42b9e6c01cd0b186
Closes-Bug: #1247019

commit_message:
Command call should log the stdout and stderr

Our utils.execute method did not log the stdout and stderr message
for command call, for these message, they are required for us to
track command call stdout and std error in details.

Change-Id: Ibfb15c3a004f1c2c091e59f452ebaaceeebd934d
Closes-Bug: #1242544
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/64/61664/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: return processutils.execute(*cmd, **kwargs)

commit_message:
Updates tox.ini to use new features

Reasons:
 - tox update v1.6

Changes:
 - tox 1.6 allows us to skip the sdist step, which is slow.
 - It also allows us to override the install line. In this case, it's
   important as it allows us to stop getting pre-release software we
   weren't asking for.

Original patch by Monty Taylor, talked about here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-September/015495.html

Change-Id: Ib51796afbfdffb5a879046ca1b94a55b1f6ef6f1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient refs/changes/26/60826/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: minversion = 1.6 skipsdist = Trueusedevelop = True install_command = pip install {opts} {packages}

commit_message:
Neutron expects /etc/neutron/plugin.ini

Neutron expects /etc/neutron/plugin.ini to contain the Neutron plugin
configuration, or to be a symlink to it. The guide incorrectly referred
to /etc/neutron/plugins.ini (not the s).

The typo has been corrected and the explicity ln command to create the
link added.

Change-Id: Ib81b8f18c71cfc9604cf41f37b7be5d221716c9b
Closes-Bug: #1260173
backport: havana
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/62/62262/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: <filename>/etc/neutron/plugins.ini</filename>.</para> <screen><prompt>#</prompt> <command>ln -s /etc/neutron/plugins/openvswitch/ovs_neutron_plugin.ini /etc/neutron/plugins.ini</command></screen>

commit_message:
Add command for creating plugins.ini symlink

Neutron expects /etc/neutron/plugins.ini to be the plugin configuration
file or, more commonly, a symlink to the plugin configuration file.

Change-Id: I172e782ba609f7f2250b5ae56d0fee1fe562165b
Closes-Bug: #1260173

commit_message:
Use ScaledResource as type for InstanceGroup members

Use the placeholder type OS::Heat::ScaledResource as the nominal resource
type for resources in an instance group. Use the environment to select the
actual underlying resource type (current AWS::EC2::Instance).

Change-Id: I52252c596fa48e57d927eb78e9d5b7c8261adb3e

commit_message:
tests: Don't access properties_schema directly

Don't rely on the properties_schema containing a dictionary in a particular
format, convert it to Schema objects and use the API. Needed for the
blueprint property-schema-conversion.

Change-Id: I1a0cd93f62bd662752cb27a294248a14446492a9

commit_message:
Set pipefail on all devtest scripts

We are missing failures of any commands which pipe their output to
another command. That is particularly troubling as, for instance, we
were recently missing the fact that the overcloud-control image was
failing to build.

Change-Id: Ied3e9a6821d6c19d7e9e82f90a461b62c7b14ddf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/50/62250/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: set -o pipefail

commit_message:
Add node-validate to cli

Add the node-validate command that triggers the validation of the 'core'
and 'standardized' driver interfaces of a given node. This will also be
used by the ironic driver on nova to validate the node driver interfaces
before deploying it.

Change-Id: I93811c9bfbfe4f7b8559fc4ce566c8d4e19a54ac

commit_message:
Nicira: Fix core_plugin path and update default values in README

The following patch fixes the core_plugin path in the README file
which broke during the rename of quantum to neutron here ee3fe4e8.
This patch also updates a few of the default values and removes
the promise of adding support for multiple control clusters.

Issue reported by: Ben Lin <blin@nicira.com>

Change-Id: Ia46d80384efaa220685f98afa591177d00021362
Closes-bug: #1260550

deleted_lines: bridged transport zone (default 64) (default 3) single cluster. In the future (Havana+) support for multiple clusters will be added. core_plugin = neutron.plugins.nicira.neutronPlugin.NvpPluginV2

commit_message:
Pin sphinx to <1.2

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

  error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

See: http://bugs.python.org/issue19570
and: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/pull-request/193/builddoc-shouldnt-fail-on-unicode-paths/diff

Change-Id: Ibe26f50eb72a0f8687670e0b7d6f280890ea7099
Co-Authored-By: "James E. Blair" <jeblair@openstack.org>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/41/62241/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Allow heat tests to use already uploaded test image

If $HEAT_FETCHED_TEST_IMAGE is set then tempest is configured to
use the image named $HEAT_FETCHED_TEST_IMAGE for any orchestration
tests which require an image.

Fallback to checking $HEAT_CREATE_TEST_IMAGE and invoking
diskimage-builder if necessary.

The intent is to use Fedora 20 as the test image for gating
since this image has heat-cfntools already installed.

Change-Id: I177ae091a641ba99fd4c618e30a39c5148ae617f

commit_message:
RBD clone from image requires disk_format raw

When creating an rbd volume from image, each driver is now
provided with the image disk_format. The RBD driver will refuse
to do a clone if the image is not of disk_format 'raw' which will
result in the image being converted to raw prior to creating the
volume.

Also converted corresponding unit test to use mock (instead
of mox).

Change-Id: I3fab61196039dc2cc34edef75d5f00989634a99a
Closes-bug: 1247998
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/93/58893/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: model_update = {} cloned = False # Only attempt clone if the image is in raw format otherwise conversion # is required and thus a full copy. disk_format = image_meta.get('disk_format', None) if disk_format == 'raw': # Create the volume from an image. # # NOTE (singn): two params need to be returned # dict containing provider_location for cloned volume # and clone status. model_update, cloned = self.driver.clone_image(volume_ref, image_location, image_id) else: LOG.debug(_("image %(image_id)s disk_format is not raw " "(%(disk_format)s) - forcing conversion and full " "copy") % {'image_id': image_id, 'disk_format': disk_format})
deleted_lines: # Create the volume from an image. # # NOTE (singn): two params need to be returned # dict containing provider_location for cloned volume # and clone status. model_update, cloned = self.driver.clone_image( volume_ref, image_location, image_id)

the loop. Also, getting all security groups is done only once.

Thus there is no need to write another test to check NoUniqueMatch

Change-Id: I3091ebf87923ca2e6e97e409dc9c2d95f8854af7

commit_message:
Simplify security group search logic

This will also speed up search since encoding is moved out of the
the loop. Also, getting all security groups is done only once.
The code to check if multiple matches are found is dead since
nova does not allow creating multiple security groups with same name
Thus there is no need to write another test to check NoUniqueMatch
exception.

Change-Id: I3091ebf87923ca2e6e97e409dc9c2d95f8854af7
Closes-Bug: #1254945
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/52/61952/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: matches = [] encoding = (locale.getpreferredencoding() or sys.stdin.encoding or 'UTF-8') groups = cs.security_groups.list() for group in groups: if not six.PY3: group.name = group.name.encode(encoding) if secgroup == group.name: matches.append(group) if len(matches) > 1: msg = ("Multiple security group matches found for name" " '%s', use an ID to be more specific." % secgroup) raise exceptions.NoUniqueMatch(msg) elif len(matches) == 0: else: return matches[0]
deleted_lines: match_found = False for s in cs.security_groups.list(): encoding = (locale.getpreferredencoding() or sys.stdin.encoding or 'UTF-8') s.name = s.name.encode(encoding) if secgroup == s.name: if match_found is not False: msg = ("Multiple security group matches found for name" " '%s', use an ID to be more specific." % secgroup) raise exceptions.NoUniqueMatch(msg) match_found = s if match_found is False: return match_found

commit_message:
Add CONFIG_SCHEMA to openstack provider

SCHEMA_TEMPLATE was renamed to CONFIG_SCHEMA and moved to the class
scope.

Also, config validation was deleted from OpenStackProvider constructor
for using specified validation method in the base class.

Change-Id: Ia71d1858bd5a8b313e52188bfec3d95f100f5a8c

commit_message:
NVP plugin: Do backend router delete out from db transaction

Performing the NVP API operation from within a DB transaction
increases the risk of a deadlock between sqlalchemy and eventlet.

With this patch, the operation is moved outside of the db transaction
and appropriate mechanism are put in place for:
i) ensuring neutron db consistency in case of NVP failures
ii) avoiding deleting from backend if neutron logic does not allow it

This patch also synchronizes the routine for removing a router
gateway port from NVP.

Change-Id: I58d156e303e7a56ceb8c62766c192e154b0a3bb4
Closes-Bug: #1258150
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/04/61604/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(salv-orlando): This call should have no effect on delete # router, but if it does, it should not happen within a # transaction, and it should be restored on rollback # Pre-delete checks # NOTE(salv-orlando): These checks will be repeated anyway when # calling the superclass. This is wasteful, but is the simplest # way of ensuring a consistent removal of the router both in # the neutron Database and in the NVP backend. # TODO(salv-orlando): split pre-delete checks and actual # deletion in superclass. # Ensure that the router is not used fips = self.get_floatingips_count( context.elevated(), filters={'router_id': [router_id]}) if fips: raise l3.RouterInUse(router_id=router_id) device_filter = {'device_id': [router_id], 'device_owner': [l3_db.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_INTF]} ports = self._core_plugin.get_ports_count(context.elevated(), filters=device_filter) if ports: raise l3.RouterInUse(router_id=router_id) # It is safe to remove the router from the database, so remove it # from the backend try: self._delete_lrouter(context, router_id) except q_exc.NotFound: # This is not a fatal error, but needs to be logged LOG.warning(_("Logical router '%s' not found " "on NVP Platform"), router_id) except NvpApiClient.NvpApiException: raise nvp_exc.NvpPluginException( err_msg=(_("Unable to delete logical router '%s' " "on NVP Platform") % router_id)) # Perform the actual delete on the Neutron DB try: except Exception: # NOTE(salv-orlando): Broad cacthing as the following action # needs to be performed for every exception. # Put the router in ERROR status with context.session.begin(subtransactions=True): router_db = self._get_router(context, router_id) router_db['status'] = constants.NET_STATUS_ERROR
deleted_lines: # Ensure metadata access network is detached and destroyed # This will also destroy relevant objects on NVP platform. # NOTE(salvatore-orlando): A failure in this operation will # cause the router delete operation to fail too. # If removal is successful in Neutron it should be so on # the NVP platform too - otherwise the transaction should # be automatically aborted # TODO(salvatore-orlando): Extend the object models in order to # allow an extra field for storing the cluster information # together with the resource try: self._delete_lrouter(context, router_id) except q_exc.NotFound: LOG.warning(_("Logical router '%s' not found " "on NVP Platform"), router_id) except NvpApiClient.NvpApiException: raise nvp_exc.NvpPluginException( err_msg=(_("Unable to delete logical router '%s' " "on NVP Platform") % router_id))

commit_message:
Cleanup backend loading

Backend creation was happening at import time. This changes the
code so that backend creation time is controlled by calling a
function.

This also allows sharing the backend creation code between the
server and the tests.

Change-Id: Ib817aa341de510a46faa8ed0bc24ef9268fa944b

commit_message:
GlusterFS: Complete snapshot_delete when info doesn't exist

The snapshot_delete operation will fail if the snapshot info file
doesn't contain a record for the snapshot, or does not exist.
This happens in cases such as when snapshot_create fails to commit
anything to disk.

The driver should allow the manager to delete the snapshot
in this case, as there is no action required for the driver
to delete anything.

Closes-Bug: #1252864

Change-Id: I8686a1be09dbb7984072538bff6c026bb84eeb52

commit_message:
Remove test that was no longer used for long

test_too_big_volume() case in test_volume.py was legacy from nova-
volume, it was never actually testing anything.  This change removes
this case for good.

Change-Id: I66e0eb80326f039ddc580dec0409fd4090ba5102

commit_message:
WIP: Add ECU setting for libvirt

ECU(Elastic Compute Unit) is for implementing the similar virtual
machine performance on several heterogeneous nova-compute servers.

There is the way to configure cpu_quota and cpu_period with flavor
extra_spec already. However, that way can not implement the similar
virtual machine performance on different performance servers.
We need the different ratio of cpu_quota and cpu_period for each
server performance for adjusting the virtual machine performance,
but the extra_spec of a flavor contains the same ratio of cpu_quota
and cpu_period.

This patch adds some configuration items for adjusting cpu_quota and
cpu_period on each nova-compute server.

Related to blueprint nova-ecu-support

Change-Id: I8835fa03d16792dfbec9a9f36f5171c8ea1e3e53
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/94/58694/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # enable ecu(EC2 Compute Unit) support (boolean value) #ecu_enabled=false # Cpu period for each ecu (integer value) #ecu_cpu_period=100000 # Cpu quota for each ecu. This value should depend on # the hardware performance of each compute node. # If the performance is higher than the other compute # node, this value should be smaller than the other for # adjusting the same vm performance. (integer value) #ecu_cpu_quota=100000

commit_message:
Refactor setup_logging

This change just cleans up the setup_logging function. It was
defined in keystone.common.config and then also exported from
keystone.config. Also, it had extra parameters that were unused.

This takes care of a NOTE (which probably should have been a
TODO) in the code.

Change-Id: I1a46c8974cbd68a5bf708d253adfadc1fdb76dcd

commit_message:
Change Port create API to EAFP

Port creation in API is LBYL, but should be EAFP, we have
UniqueConstraint on address column, just catch the exception and
handle to show client a useful information.

Change-Id: I6846e440c38543d4f4f19dae44d774df2e04107e
Closes-Bug: #1244348

commit_message:
Get test_openAuth_can_refuse_None_uri to cleanup after itself

test_openAuth_can_refuse_None_uri sets the global
libvirt.allow_default_uri_connection to False but it leaves
it in this state which could cause test_tpool_execute_calls_libvirt
to fail if it ran immediately afterwards. This patch adds a cleanup
so _reset is called at the end of the test and not just if
another test in the same class is run after it.

Change-Id: I9762fcb81b2318beeb056c67bd9172056e1449ab
Closes-Bug: 1258553
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/09/60709/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.addCleanup(libvirt._reset)

commit_message:
Allow configuring the wsgi pool size

Expose the number of greenthreads in wsgi pool to configuration. This
allows to put a limit to the number of resources like memcache
connections used.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I6e53d6e12661ed2f42a6b543891b13eec0c8300c

commit_message:
Install Guide: cinder setup for ceilometer fixes

* openstack-cinder-volume should be restarted, not
  openstack-cinder-agent-central
* use 'ceilometer' instead of 'cinder' in the section id

Change-Id: Id9cbab26ed8aa9d09b98da93576ff7aad8c304b7
Closes-Bug: #1259456
backport: havana

commit_message:
Remove deprecated code

Essex and keystoneclient 0.1.1 have deprecated and is no
longer supported by the Openstack project so remove
the keystoneclient tests for them.

Change-Id: Ia083ecbfa8e488fd33eb3e8c47fc532196de7ca8
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/23/60523/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Create user returns 400 without a password

If it is intended to create a new user without password (is optional)
keystone user-create --name <name>
keystone fails returning error 400.

The change consist in checking if the request has password: None
don't make the password hash

Co-Authored-By: huangtianhua<huangtianhua@huawei.com>
Closes-Bug: #1245342
Change-Id: If6f5789dcec0610a237f286d0d17ad4b100ef5f3

commit_message:
Remove unused variables in neutron api interface and neutron tests

My local pyfakes checker in my editor keeps pointing these out
each time I save these files so I'd like to stop the messages.

commit_message:
Add -U to pip install command in tox.ini

Ask pip to upgrade packages in the virtualenv so that a long-lived
virtualenv is still kept up to date as external dependencies change.

Change-Id: I0256cf4cc3aa7675956762dcf056e2709d36813a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient refs/changes/08/61508/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: install_command = pip install -U {opts} {packages}
deleted_lines: install_command = pip install {opts} {packages}

commit_message:
Updates tox.ini to use new features

tox 1.6 allows us to skip the sdist step, which is slow. This does that.
It also allows us to override the install line. In this case, it's
important as it allows us to stop getting pre-release software we
weren't asking for.

Original patch by Monty Taylor, talked about here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-September/015495.html

Change-Id: I2042cae5ebf5467408fe6cdb71f6147081b72ca6

subject: Deny API requests where context doesn't match path
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-11 15:14:35.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_api_openstack_v1_util.py', 'heat/tests/test_api_openstack_v1.py', 'heat/api/openstack/v1/util.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/22f4fdafc0ac5cf86bd3b87faace5175fb8dc2c2', 'message': "Deny API requests where context doesn't match path

We shouldn't overwrite the context tenant_id (which comes from the
scope of the auth_token) with that from the path, instead raise a
HTTPForbidden exception if the path-provided tenant_id doesn't match
the context.

Change-Id: Ib6fb9881103312f7492081a20178f12309f35d81
Closes-Bug: #1256983
"}]
commit_message:
Deny API requests where context doesn't match path

We shouldn't overwrite the context tenant_id (which comes from the
scope of the auth_token) with that from the path, instead raise a
HTTPForbidden exception if the path-provided tenant_id doesn't match
the context.

Change-Id: Ib6fb9881103312f7492081a20178f12309f35d81
Closes-Bug: #1256983
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/56/61456/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Decorator for a handler method that checks the path matches the if req.context.tenant_id != tenant_id: raise exc.HTTPForbidden()
deleted_lines: Decorator for a handler method that sets the correct tenant_id in the req.context.tenant_id = tenant_id

commit_message:
Sync global requirements to pin sphinx to sphinx>=1.1.2,<1.2

Sync the global requirements to pin sphinx.  This addresses an issue
where Sphinx 1.2 is not building documents correctly and causing
check/gate to fail.

We also had to adjust the pip command used.

Change-Id: I8894c0199db845e90e5086a7c0e6bb7c7a26b5a0

commit_message:
Bad workflow-steps check: has_required_fields

Many of the tabs on the Instance Creation screen don't show a "*"
despite having require fields.  This is due to faulty logic in determining
whether the workflow-step has require fields.  (Previously, only keys from
the contributes list were checked.)

Change-Id: Id609da27c51f8d4725683d7fd1534ead0c3bb984
Closes-Bug: 1252005
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/30/61530/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: for key in self.contributes: field = self.action.fields.get(key, None) if (field and field.required): return True return False

of Object Storage/Swift than was already written. This is a first
attempt at making it better.

This patch also uncomments a line within the 'admin-guide-cloud' book
that doesn't reference the common 'about-object-storage' page like others
do. I've reverted this and tested thoroughly, not sure why this was there.

clarity. For example- the 'Getting Started' page provided only a very
basic overview of the components and without going into too much detail
I added further information. There were also a few English syntax changes
throughout some of the other pages.

commit_message:
Updated: About OpenStack Object Storage Document

One of the TODO entries was to provide a more comprehensive overview
of Object Storage/Swift than was already written. This is a first
attempt at making it better.

This patch also uncomments a line within the 'admin-guide-cloud' book
that doesn't reference the common 'about-object-storage' page like others
do. I've reverted this and tested thoroughly, not sure why this was there.

In addition, I updated a few other pages where they lacked certain
clarity. For example- the 'Getting Started' page provided only a very
basic overview of the components and without going into too much detail
I added further information. There were also a few English syntax changes
throughout some of the other pages.

Change-Id: I1952d9e1882fc962320304759110a2ccbc50de82
backport: havana

commit_message:
Remove unneeded call to conductor in network interface

The following patch removes an unneeded call to conductor to retrieve
data already available in instance.

Note: six.text_type() was added and wrapped around info_cache in some of
the tests. This was done because values from the db are in unicode
(text_type). The reason the test changed is because previously we
did not check the type of string from what the conductor was returning.

Closes-bug: #1258360

Change-Id: I45a24af11534911be68fd0964b79fdf726d88de6

commit_message:
Make live migrations work for non volume-backed instances with RBD

* Add a new ceph user and pool for ephemeral storage
* Update nova configuration to store ephemeral volumes in RBD pool
* Open libvirt ports requred for live migration
* Restrict VNC traffic to management network

Change-Id: I772c6d94de4537ad82d4b62822bdc4f702e8ff56
Implements: blueprint ceph-live-migration

commit_message:
Add IPAddress field type in object models

In object models, there are ipv4 address type and ipv6 address type.
However, for some fields in models.py, for instance, host_ip in compute node,
and a bunch of IPAddress variables in network, and address in other tables.

There is no field type corresponding to them, no matter whether it is v4 or
v6. So, add one more field type in object models to specify that type.

Change-Id: Ic53ed644f4bbc1e280b2f8cbb9b9c145c3d8a2e9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/50/58950/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class IPAddress(FieldType): return netaddr.IPAddress(value)class IPV4Address(IPAddress): def coerce(self, obj, attr, value): result = super(IPV4Address, self).coerce(obj, attr, value) if result.version != 4: raise ValueError(_('Network "%s" is not valid') % value) return result class IPV6Address(IPAddress): def coerce(self, obj, attr, value): result = super(IPV6Address, self).coerce(obj, attr, value) if result.version != 6: raise ValueError(_('Network "%s" is not valid') % value) return resultclass IPAddressField(AutoTypedField): AUTO_TYPE = IPAddress()
deleted_lines: class IPV4Address(FieldType): return netaddr.IPAddress(value, version=4)class IPV6Address(FieldType): def coerce(self, obj, attr, value): try: return netaddr.IPAddress(value, version=6) except netaddr.AddrFormatError as e: raise ValueError(str(e)) def from_primitive(self, obj, attr, value): return self.coerce(obj, attr, value) def to_primitive(self, obj, attr, value): return str(value)

commit_message:
Enables H306 pep8 rules

Updates tox.ini to reduce ignored rules.

commit_message:
Add a control point for floating IP assignment

In the basic network scenario test, the test for accessiblity via the
floating IP stands a very good chance of failing because the attempt to
connect begins before the system has had a chance to associate the
floating IP address.  While an extended delay does signify a performance
issue for those types of operations, the timing of the test can be
adversly affected by other factors (e.g. parallel tests, loaded test
  system). If it is extreme the check for the IP address will fail the
test as well. This addition also covers a loophole in the test where
the connectivity would work but the metadata that is provided through
the client call is not updated properly.

An additional small fix in manager.py resolves an issue when a client
API uses mixed or lower case for status strings (e.g. cinder).

There isn't a specific bug that this modification addresses.

Change-Id: Ifb1889f67588e6ee4d19f592da61ab574d456be2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/17/59517/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import tempest.testclass FloatingIPCheckTracker(object): """ Checking VM connectivity through floating IP addresses is bound to fail if the floating IP has not actually been associated with the VM yet. This helper class facilitates checking for floating IP assignments on VMs. It only checks for a given IP address once. """ def __init__(self, compute_client, floating_ip_map): self.compute_client = compute_client self.unchecked = {} for k in floating_ip_map.keys(): self.unchecked[k] = [f.floating_ip_address for f in floating_ip_map[k]] def run_checks(self): """ Check for any remaining unverified floating IPs Gets VM details from nova and checks for floating IPs within the returned information. Returns true when all checks are complete and is suitable for use with tempest.test.call_until_true() """ checked = [] to_delete = [] for k, check_addrs in self.unchecked.iteritems(): serverdata = self.compute_client.servers.get(k.id) for net_name, ip_addr in serverdata.networks.iteritems(): for addr in ip_addr: if addr in check_addrs: check_addrs.remove(addr) if len(check_addrs) == 0: to_delete.append(k) for to_del in to_delete: del self.unchecked[to_del] return len(self.unchecked) == 0 @classmethod def tearDownClass(cls): super(TestNetworkBasicOps, cls).tearDownClass() try: for server in self.servers: for net_name, ip_addresses in server.networks.iteritems(): for ip_address in ip_addresses: self._check_vm_connectivity(ip_address, ssh_login, private_key) except Exception as exc: LOG.exception(exc) debug.log_ip_ns() raise exc def _wait_for_floating_ip_association(self): ip_tracker = FloatingIPCheckTracker(self.compute_client, self.floating_ips) self.assertTrue( tempest.test.call_until_true( ip_tracker.run_checks, self.config.compute.build_timeout, 5), "Timed out while waiting for the floating IP assignments " "to propagate") self._wait_for_floating_ip_association() self._check_public_network_connectivity()
deleted_lines: for server in self.servers: for net_name, ip_addresses in server.networks.iteritems(): for ip_address in ip_addresses: self._check_vm_connectivity(ip_address, ssh_login, private_key) self._check_public_network_connectivity()

subject: Add whitelist entry for s-proxy 'Timeout talking to memcached'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-14 02:31:57.000000000', 'files': ['etc/whitelist.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/ed13d4a2dc14a99b38075694055e53189d0bcc1e', 'message': 'Add whitelist entry for s-proxy 'Timeout talking to memcached'

According to John Dickinson:

"This isn't an error. It's logged at an error level because it may hint
at other problems, and it's something an operator needs to know about,
but it is not an unhandled failure condition. (Think of it similarly how
in swift a server being down is an "error", but it's something that
swift seamlessly works around.)"

Closes-Bug: #1260894

Change-Id: I41e55c5e34ee214727fbbd7b9daa1f6ea9bf8050
'}]
commit_message:
Add whitelist entry for s-proxy 'Timeout talking to memcached'

According to John Dickinson:

"This isn't an error. It's logged at an error level because it may hint
at other problems, and it's something an operator needs to know about,
but it is not an unhandled failure condition. (Think of it similarly how
in swift a server being down is an "error", but it's something that
swift seamlessly works around.)"

Closes-Bug: #1260894

Change-Id: I41e55c5e34ee214727fbbd7b9daa1f6ea9bf8050
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/28/62128/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: s-proxy: - module: "proxy-server" message: "Timeout talking to memcached"

commit_message:
Set pipefail for wrapper scripts

Previously if the testr list command was failing subunit2py would
return a 0 making the test runs that use the pretty_tox scripts also
return 0 despite testr actually failing. This commit gets around this
condition by setting pipefail in the pretty_tox scripts to ensure that
we actually fail.

Change-Id: I9cbaf83cfea7c02133b27fe639e7ea12edb48f7e

commit_message:
Add API ref for FlavorDisabled extension

Added a new section, which should be accessible via
http://api.openstack.org/api-ref-compute.html#os-flv-disabled
(after change merged)
which shows the sample responses in this directory:
api-ref/src/wadls/compute-api/src/api_samples/OS-FLV-DISABLED

More about the 'disabled' filed in 'flavor'
http://openstack.markmail.org/thread/zi7bkeqlnjbtkz5t

Patch2:
added missing file os-flv-disabled.wadl

Patch3:
Using sentence-style caps for titles

Use <literal></literal> tag to surround OS-FLV-DISABLED:disabled

Change tenant_id to be of type "xsd:string" from the name space
xmlns:xsd="http://docs.rackspacecloud.com/xsd/v1.0"

Change-Id: Ida174590303b46fe7c8b2ca4ce26a1632daf2762
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1089019

commit_message:
Pass Instance object to console output virt driver api

Update the get_console_output() method of the virt driver API to be
defined to accept an Instance object.  While we're at it, pass the
context, as well.

Change-Id: If325a39f6314cff936e604fcc5816deefbb1199b

commit_message:
Send Instance object to validate_console_port

Update the validate_console_port() method of the compute rpc api to take
in an Instance object instead of a dict.  The object_compat() decorator
is used to ensure the change is backwards compatible, and that the code
will still work if it receives an instance in dict format.

Change-Id: Ief8fabc8490315acb41bf85ad421683fea31daf9

commit_message:
Rename instance_type to flavor in test_utils and nova.tests.utils

Renames occurrences of 'instance_type' to 'flavor' in
nova.tests.test_utils and nova.tests.utils along with any impacted tests
using the changed parts.

Part of blueprint flavor-instance-type-dedup

Change-Id: Ie816356c176c2be61b4a346a4d47d8f3461ae84a

deleted_lines: def get_instance_type(self): instance_type = { return instance_type instance_type = self.get_instance_type() sys_meta = utils.get_system_metadata_from_image(image, instance_type) # instance_type's root_gb when using vhd disk format self.assertEqual(sys_meta[sys_key], instance_type["root_gb"])

commit_message:
Fix typos in documents

Fix typos detected by toolkit misspellings.

 * pip install misspellings
 * git ls-files | grep -v locale | misspellings -f -

Closes-Bug: #1257295
Change-Id: Ibb5917ab5af541a381630bd013b05d22badd4364

commit_message:
rename get_pid_file to ensure_get_pid_file

Function of get_pid_file doesn't simply do the readonly operation of
obtaining pid_file. Change the function name to better describe its
purpose

Change-Id: Ieb892393897e9bf9fdfde2fb8ee1384cd188ac0a

commit_message:
Fix and enable gating on H702

Formatting operations should be outside of localization,
otherwise translation lookup will never find a translated
string as a match. This also fixes H701 alongway.

Change-Id: I6708e0f5b11841b18ba9042ac4958643f91396dd

commit_message:
Handle the case of pipe char in value for iniset

iniset did not handle the case of "|" in the value
to be injected. Fix this by replacing | with \000 (NULL).

Fixes bug #1258050

Change-Id: I8882c2f3f177ebdfa0c66270dbbc7fd50f30b065

commit_message:
remove a spurious wait that could get us into trouble

it's not really clear that this wait is useful for anything
except generating bugs when we've done terible things to the
image during this test. Removing it as unneeded.

Change-Id: I88546bf3845d8e62d4baf5572f0403c0eaa983ba
Closes-Bug: #1229890

LOGLVL=1 LOG_DIR="/var/log/murano" # Functions # Loger function log() { MSG=$1 if [ $LOGLVL -gt 0 ]; then echo "LOG:> $MSG" fi } # patching horizon configuration modify_horizon_config() { REMOVE=$2 if [ -f $1 ]; then lines=$(sed -ne '/^#START_MURANO_DASHBOARD/,/^#END_MURANO_DASHBOARD/ =' $1) if [ -n "$lines" ]; then if [ ! -z $REMOVE ]; then log "Removing our data from \"$1\"..." sed -e '/^#START_MURANO_DASHBOARD/,/^#END_MURANO_DASHBOARD/ d' -i $1 if [ $? -ne 0 ];then log "Can't modify \"$1\", check permissions or something else, exiting!!!" exit fi else log "\"$1\" already has our data, you can change it manually and restart apache2 service" fi else if [ -z $REMOVE ];then log "Adding our data into \"$1\"..." cat >> $1 << EOF #START_MURANO_DASHBOARD HORIZON_CONFIG['dashboards'] += ('murano',) INSTALLED_APPS += ('muranodashboard','floppyforms',) MIDDLEWARE_CLASSES += ('muranodashboard.middleware.ExceptionMiddleware',) verbose_formatter = {'verbose': {'format': '[%(asctime)s] [%(levelname)s] [pid=%(process)d] %(message)s'}} if 'formatters' in LOGGING: LOGGING['formatters'].update(verbose_formatter) else: LOGGING['formatters'] = verbose_formatter LOGGING['handlers']['murano-file'] = {'level': 'DEBUG', 'formatter': 'verbose', 'class': 'logging.FileHandler', 'filename': '$LOG_DIR/murano-dashboard.log'} LOGGING['loggers']['muranodashboard'] = {'handlers': ['murano-file'], 'level': 'DEBUG'} LOGGING['loggers']['muranoclient'] = {'handlers': ['murano-file'], 'level': 'ERROR'} #MURANO_API_URL = "http://localhost:8082" #MURANO_METADATA_URL = "http://localhost:8084" #if murano-api set up with ssl uncomment next strings #MURANO_API_INSECURE = True #END_MURANO_DASHBOARD EOF if [ $? -ne 0 ];then log "Can't modify \"$1\", check permissions or something else, exiting!!!" fi fi fi else echo "File \"$1\" not found, exiting!!!" exit 1 fi } # Command line args' COMMAND="$1" cfg_file="/usr/share/openstack-dashboard/openstack_dashboard/settings.py" case $COMMAND in install ) modify_horizon_config $cfg_file ;; uninstall ) modify_horizon_config $cfg_file remove ;; * ) exit 1 ;; esac

revisions:

commit_message:
Pin Sphinx to <1.2

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

  error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

See: http://bugs.python.org/issue19570
and: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/pull-request/193/builddoc-shouldnt-fail-on-unicode-paths/diff

Change-Id: I0487b4eca8f2755b882689289e3cdf429729b1fb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/03/62103/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update swift-config paste appconfig inspection

This crafts a significantly more informative and complete picture of the
appconfig object after paste has gotten a hold of it.

Change-Id: I07d7248ecf384f32d333025874ecb2782c58d6af
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/14/62114/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _context_name(context): return ':'.join((context.object_type.name, context.name)) def inspect_app_config(app_config): conf = {} context = app_config.context section_name = _context_name(context) conf[section_name] = context.config() if context.object_type.name == 'pipeline': filters = context.filter_contexts pipeline = [] for filter_context in filters: conf[_context_name(filter_context)] = filter_context.config() pipeline.append(filter_context.entry_point_name) app_context = context.app_context conf[_context_name(app_context)] = app_context.config() pipeline.append(app_context.entry_point_name) conf[section_name]['pipeline'] = ' '.join(pipeline) return conf conf = inspect_app_config(app_config)
deleted_lines: context = app_config.context conf = dict([(c.name, c.config()) for c in getattr( context, 'filter_contexts', [])]) conf[context.name] = app_config

subject: Prevent spoofing instance_id from neutron to nova
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-11 14:27:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/92fdc0ac6cd5e2706235befe81d9d9e4e6c9d5d1', 'message': "Prevent spoofing instance_id from neturon to nova

Previously, one could update a port's device_id in neutron to be
that of another tenant's instance_id and then be able to retrieve
that instance's metadata. This patch prevents this from occuring by
checking that X-Tenant-ID received from the metadata request matches
the tenant_id in the nova database.

DocImpact - This patch is dependent on another patch in neutron
            which adds X-Tenant-ID to the request. Therefore to
            minimize downtime one should upgrade Neutron first (then
            restart neutron-metadata-agent) and lastly update nova.

Change-Id: I93bf662797c3986324ca2099b403833c2e990fb4
Closes-Bug: #1235450
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-11 20:39:22.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/metadata/handler.py', 'nova/tests/test_metadata.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/af2f823107010933ecd94a9c938f8b739baaecb7', 'message': "Prevent spoofing instance_id from neutron to nova

Previously, one could update a port's device_id in neutron to be
that of another tenant's instance_id and then be able to retrieve
that instance's metadata. This patch prevents this from occurring by
checking that X-Tenant-ID received from the metadata request matches
the tenant_id in the nova database.

DocImpact - This patch is dependent on another patch in neutron
            which adds X-Tenant-ID to the request. Therefore to
            minimize downtime one should upgrade Neutron first (then
            restart neutron-metadata-agent) and lastly update nova.

Change-Id: I93bf662797c3986324ca2099b403833c2e990fb4
Closes-Bug: #1235450
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent spoofing instance_id from neutron to nova

Previously, one could update a port's device_id in neutron to be
that of another tenant's instance_id and then be able to retrieve
that instance's metadata. This patch prevents this from occurring by
checking that X-Tenant-ID received from the metadata request matches
the tenant_id in the nova database.

DocImpact - This patch is dependent on another patch in neutron
            which adds X-Tenant-ID to the request. Therefore to
            minimize downtime one should upgrade Neutron first (then
            restart neutron-metadata-agent) and lastly update nova.

Change-Id: I93bf662797c3986324ca2099b403833c2e990fb4
Closes-Bug: #1235450

commit_message:
Support warning messages in SelfHandlingForm

Sometimes we need to show a prominent message at the top of a form to
warn the user about something. One example is trying to snapshot an
in-use volume.

Change-Id: I073fe6bd049eb90b7a6ed45abfad96ebda3510eb
Related-Bug: #1202929

commit_message:
Fix missing policy enforcement in CFN API

Currently the CreateStack and UpdateStack actions aren't correctly
enforcing the policy, so add calls to _enforce which fixes that,
and rework the test to illustrate the issue.

Change-Id: Ia5c2e65512ab9d1c163171f8617c081ab96745e5
Closes-Bug: #1256049

commit_message:
Enable usage of proxies defined in environment (http(s)_proxy).

As far as proxies usage is concerned, keystone-client API and swift-client API behave differently because the former uses python Request library while the latter uses raw httplib. As a result, Keystone authentication honors environment variables http_proxy, https_proxy and no_proxy while Swift doesn't.

This patch, which code is mainly borrowed from Python Requests, makes Swift
data connections and Swift authentication connections behaving homogeneously.

Change-Id: Ic8a0089c35c458d7ed96e572e22429014298fe4c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-swiftclient refs/changes/82/58282/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Don't save mysql logs

Currently a full tempest run produces 600MiB of _compressed_ log data,
of which 324MiB are mysql logs.  This is because devstack configures
the mysql slow query log to log every query.  This seems like an
excessive level of debugging for the gate, so lets not save those
logs.

Change-Id: Ib4cdfc929b93b289916295ff365a46979555a574
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/20/61820/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: if [ -d /var/log/mysql ] ; then sudo cp -a /var/log/mysql $WORKSPACE/logs/ fi if [ -d $WORKSPACE/logs/mysql ]; then rename 's/\.log$/.txt/' $WORKSPACE/logs/mysql/* fi

commit_message:
Pass Instance object to compute vnc rpc api

Pass a real Instance object to the get_vnc_console() method of the
compute rpc api.  The object_compat() decorator is used to provide
backwards compatibility with receiving data in the old format.

Change-Id: Ib615fd653e0ef6196241fde81f541b1e18eb3ced

Closes-Bug: #1242815

commit_message:
Destroy docker container if spawn fails to set up network

If docker driver failed to set up network when spawn an instance,
then the docker driver should also destroy the container to make
sure no garbage container left for such case.

Change-Id: Ia1828425d246601b6e1403c59f1768b6ae593afc
Closes-Bug: #1242815
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/45/53045/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Updates tox.ini to use new features

tox 1.6 allows us to skip the sdist step, which is slow. This does that.
It also allows us to override the install line. In this case, it's
important as it allows us to stop getting pre-release software we
weren't asking for.

Original patch by Monty Taylor, talked about here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-September/015495.html

Change-Id: I87f172cfcc44c9afff9c5162791d6c6b31972702

deleted_lines: [testenv]

commit_message:
HTTPretty: update to 0.7.1

The 0.7.1 release has a fix for the parse_querystring function, which raised a
TypeError on Python 3.3. See:

https://github.com/gabrielfalcao/HTTPretty/commit/5c6e776

This helps fix some tests on Python3.3 in python-keystoneclient.

Change-Id: If14a0afe9d42602e978377d6f6ee830affe0cc41

commit_message:
Don't replace (and log) the same resource entry

Resources may be registered multiple times. This
ensures that logs are only emitted the first time
a resource is registered.

Change-Id: Iedd12d55007ee24ea6ecbe4fe7152ff65ea665b0

subject: Require List objects to be able to backlevel their contents
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-11-25 22:53:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d3c8d4ecea9ded347de6b0fb1d0ecee4a615f21d', 'message': 'Require List objects to be able to backlevel their contents

Right now, a client declares its supported version of a given object
automatically in the remoted calls it makes to conductor. However,
in the case of things like InstanceList.get_by_foo(), they are
reporting the version of their InstanceList object, not their
Instance object. Conductor fills a version-matching InstanceList
object with brand new Instance objects, which the client, of course,
barfs on.

There may be a better way to handle this going forward, but for now,
stop the bleeding by requiring a version bump to the corresponding
List object whenever the object type it contains takes a version
bump. This adds a test to validate that all the objects registered
have a suitable mapping for the current version in the tree.

Since this actually caused a breakage in the Instance object
recently, this also bumps the InstanceList version so that
conductors running this commit (or later) will properly send
version 1.9 Instance objects to Havana clients and version 1.10+
to newer ones.

Change-Id: I2668dead4784fbd0411d1b6372a9a8006eeb2e84
Closes-bug: #1254902
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-11-26 14:42:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/153042360157a104d6017643cdef7abb35929e45', 'message': 'Require List objects to be able to backlevel their contents

Right now, a client declares its supported version of a given object
automatically in the remoted calls it makes to conductor. However,
in the case of things like InstanceList.get_by_foo(), they are
reporting the version of their InstanceList object, not their
Instance object. Conductor fills a version-matching InstanceList
object with brand new Instance objects, which the client, of course,
barfs on.

There may be a better way to handle this going forward, but for now,
stop the bleeding by requiring a version bump to the corresponding
List object whenever the object type it contains takes a version
bump. This adds a test to validate that all the objects registered
have a suitable mapping for the current version in the tree.

Since this actually caused a breakage in the Instance object
recently, this also bumps the InstanceList version so that
conductors running this commit (or later) will properly send
version 1.9 Instance objects to Havana clients and version 1.10+
to newer ones.

Change-Id: I2668dead4784fbd0411d1b6372a9a8006eeb2e84
Closes-Bug: #1254902
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2013-11-26 20:37:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/bdeceab0c98940757b7a301d1d519be424a96d1d', 'message': 'Require List objects to be able to backlevel their contents

Right now, a client declares its supported version of a given object
automatically in the remoted calls it makes to conductor. However,
in the case of things like InstanceList.get_by_foo(), they are
reporting the version of their InstanceList object, not their
Instance object. Conductor fills a version-matching InstanceList
object with brand new Instance objects, which the client, of course,
barfs on.

There may be a better way to handle this going forward, but for now,
stop the bleeding by requiring a version bump to the corresponding
List object whenever the object type it contains takes a version
bump. This adds a test to validate that all the objects registered

commit_message:
Require List objects to be able to backlevel their contents

Right now, a client declares its supported version of a given object
automatically in the remoted calls it makes to conductor. However,
in the case of things like InstanceList.get_by_foo(), they are
reporting the version of their InstanceList object, not their
Instance object. Conductor fills a version-matching InstanceList
object with brand new Instance objects, which the client, of course,
barfs on.

There may be a better way to handle this going forward, but for now,
stop the bleeding by requiring a version bump to the corresponding
List object whenever the object type it contains takes a version
bump. This adds a test to validate that all the objects registered
have a suitable mapping for the current version in the tree.

Since this actually caused a breakage in the Instance object
recently, this also bumps the InstanceList version so that
conductors running this commit (or later) will properly send
version 1.9 Instance objects to Havana clients and version 1.10+
to newer ones.

Change-Id: I2668dead4784fbd0411d1b6372a9a8006eeb2e84
Related-Bug: #1258256
Closes-Bug: #1254902

commit_message:
Make Instance object compatible with older compute nodes

This teaches the Instance object how to make itself compatibile with
older compute nodes running code from a few revisions ago.

Related to blueprint icehouse-objects

Change-Id: I3fe7d89751ad191c24cf6daa7e281eb480e83e1f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/47/52547/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def obj_make_compatible(self, primitive, target_version): unicode_attributes = ['user_id', 'project_id', 'image_ref', 'kernel_id', 'ramdisk_id', 'hostname', 'key_name', 'key_data', 'host', 'node', 'user_data', 'availability_zone', 'display_name', 'display_description', 'launched_on', 'locked_by', 'os_type', 'architecture', 'vm_mode', 'root_device_name', 'default_ephemeral_device', 'default_swap_device', 'config_drive', 'cell_name'] if target_version < '1.8': if ('security_groups' in primitive and primitive['security_groups'] is None): del primitive['security_groups'] if ('pci_devices' in primitive and primitive['pci_devices'] is None): del primitive['pci_devices'] if target_version < '1.7': # NOTE(danms): Before 1.7, we couldn't handle unicode in # string fields, so squash it here for field in [x for x in unicode_attributes if x in primitive]: primitive[field] = primitive[field].encode('ascii', 'replace') if target_version < '1.6': # NOTE(danms): Before 1.6 there was no pci_devices list if 'pci_devices' in primitive: del primitive['pci_devices']

commit_message:
Python3: replace urllib by six.moves.urllib

This makes the code compatible with both Python 2 and 3.

added_lines: if s == six.moves.urllib.parse.unquote(s): return six.moves.urllib.parse.quote(s) else: return s
deleted_lines: import urllib return urllib.quote(s) if s == urllib.unquote(s) else s

commit_message:
Remove start index 0 in range()

Remove the useless arg ("start index" = 0) in files, since its default
value is 0, to make code cleaner.

Fixes bug #1259750

Change-Id: I52afac28a3248895bb1c012a5934d39e7c2cc5a9

Filter valid networks to appear in create instance modal dialog

Applied a filter to select networks with subnets to the list
of available networks in the create instances form.

commit_message:
Mark dhcp ports as pending delete on subnet deletion

For plugins that use dhcp agent the deletion of dhcp ports
is done asynchronously so horizon displays the port after subnet deletion.
Need to mark such ports as pending delete to let
horizon filter and not display them

Change-Id: Ib99f07316232094cb344f68f116659c9cb462ca3
Closes-Bug: #1131730

commit_message:
Add ironic exercise in devstack

Sanity check that ironic started if enabled.
The step in ironic exercise will be added gradually in the future.

RUN_EXERCISES=ironic ./exercise.sh
This command will trigger ironic exercise separately in devstack.

Change-Id: Ifd99f737c40c24ab81c020b8b22243c106e18ace
Closes-Bug: #1256635
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/86/59286/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env bash # **ironic.sh** # Sanity check that ironic started if enabled echo "*********************************************************************" echo "Begin DevStack Exercise: $0" echo "*********************************************************************" # This script exits on an error so that errors don't compound and you see # only the first error that occurred. set -o errexit # Print the commands being run so that we can see the command that triggers # an error. It is also useful for following allowing as the install occurs. set -o xtrace # Settings # ======== # Keep track of the current directory EXERCISE_DIR=$(cd $(dirname "$0") && pwd) TOP_DIR=$(cd $EXERCISE_DIR/..; pwd) # Import common functions source $TOP_DIR/functions # Import configuration source $TOP_DIR/openrc # Import exercise configuration source $TOP_DIR/exerciserc is_service_enabled ironic || exit 55 # can we get a list versions curl http://$SERVICE_HOST:6385/ 2>/dev/null | grep -q 'versions' || die $LINENO "Ironic API not functioning!" set +o xtrace echo "*********************************************************************" echo "SUCCESS: End DevStack Exercise: $0" echo "*********************************************************************"

commit_message:
change order of cleanup_* and install_*

By logical, we shall first cleanup_*, install_*.
The two steps actually have no dependency,
thus we shall be safe for the reorder

Change-Id: I279732311cfe1cb1f73c1a2b1bec2005f9a43bf0

commit_message:
nova tests fail when run in a virtual environment

The virConnect object signature expects Uri and Readonly
parameters that the test is not passing. Fixed the test by
calling the virConnect object with all the required parameters.

Closes-Bug: #1257813
Change-Id: Ib79800a87dd64ba317fe15ee2bf19b696a3765b9

commit_message:
WIP POC of overview page

Just putting things together, to see what we are missing from ceiloemter

- To have reliable history, we are missing support of mongo's 'distinct'.
  It should land at I2 with bp complex-filter-expressions-in-api-queries

Implements bp project-overview-page-ceilometer

Change-Id: I15ae63c4919f9dfbc4d37f746e42088d8f528534

deleted_lines: jQuery.each(allowed_settings, function(index, setting_name) { if (settings[setting_name] !== undefined){ self.settings[setting_name] = settings[setting_name]; } });

subject: Do not create TaskAction for each task
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-06 09:54:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/taskflow/commit/490af518a07b1ecb77e4537c4b2267bab9f83b6a', 'message': "Do not create TaskAction for each task

Since we have a graph of tasks instead of TaskAction we don't need
to create a TaskAction for each task. This allows us to operate with
tasks directly without mapping on TaskAction.

TaskAction was a holder of task uuid. Task names are unique in the

commit_message:
Do not create TaskAction for each task

Since we have a graph of tasks instead of TaskAction we don't need
to create a TaskAction for each task. This allows us to operate with
tasks directly without mapping on TaskAction.

TaskAction was a holder of task uuid. Task names are unique in the
flow, so I decided to operate with tasks' names instead of uuids in
storage. Task uuid now is only used to store task details.

Benefits of this refactoring: speed and memory optimizations and
code clean-up, user-friendly logs (task_name is printed instead of uuid).

Change-Id: I42235fb393a3a2ee1a25139d6d91602131d12456

commit_message:
provide a global default for lock dir

this is based on one proposed upgrade path for cinder on the
openstack-dev mailing list. Instead of making oslo lockutils error
if the user has not added a config variable for lock path in their
service (which they never needed to do before) use tempdir instead.

in order to address the security concerns of file truncation attacks,
open the files for locking in 'a' mode, which will make them non
destructive to the underlying files. Add tests to ensure that we
don't truncate underlying files.

also throw an error message to the user that this isn't a safe
mode to run in. That will hopefully mean they will only use this
for the small window of rolling their cluster forward, then
configure it to something more sane.

Change-Id: Ia96a8926741464cf0d47d2c25c77b9c746c1b334

commit_message:
Add script to test all example metadata

We want to test every element that has a README.md. This will run the
test utility for each one, and report back if any failed. This is
intended to be a target for tox.ini.

Change-Id: I30806eeea979c3ad48c2e874b4e1f49da48444fb

added_lines: #!/bin/bash # # Copyright 2013 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # set -u failures= for readme in $(find elements -mindepth 2 -maxdepth 2 -name README.md) ; do path=${readme%/*} element=${path#*/} bin/test-example-metadata --cleanup-output $element if [ $? -ne 0 ] ; then failures = "${failures:+$failures }$element" echo FAIL: $element fi done if [ -n "$failures" ] ; then echo Failures: $failures echo FAIL exit 1 fi echo PASS exit 0

commit_message:
Create tests for example metadata and templates

It can be difficult to test these things in their natural environment as
typically one must build an image and deploy it. test-example-metadata
encourages making the example metadata in README.md parsable. We also
attempt to merge it with any os-apply-config templates in the element.

Change-Id: I8c92e8a4808d8c76014fa74279d8a3bbffc017c7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/54/60054/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/python # # Copyright 2013 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import argparse import json import os import shutil import subprocess import sys import tempfile import yaml import markdown def get_opts(argv): parser = argparse.ArgumentParser() parser.add_argument('element', help='element to test') parser.add_argument('--output-dir', '-o', help='Where to write template ' 'results. If not passed, a tempdir is created.') parser.add_argument('--cleanup-output', help='Wipe out output-dir after ' 'finished', default=False, action='store_true') return parser.parse_args(argv[1:]) def find_element(element): path = os.environ.get('ELEMENTS_PATH', '.').split(':') for elements_dir in path: test_dir = os.path.join(elements_dir, element) if os.path.isdir(test_dir): return test_dir return False def parse_markdown(lines): '''Return an ElementTree from a list of lines.''' md = markdown.Markdown() md.build_parser() for prep in md.preprocessors.values(): lines = prep.run(lines) root = md.parser.parseDocument(lines).getroot() return root def extract_metadata(element_dir): readme_path = os.path.join(element_dir, 'README.md') if not os.path.exists(readme_path): raise RuntimeError('Cannot find README.md in %s' % element_dir) with open(readme_path) as readme: doc = parse_markdown(readme.readlines()) for pre in doc.iterfind('pre'): # markdown says code block goes here: code = pre[-1] if code.tag != 'code' or not code.text: continue # try yaml try: return yaml.safe_load(code.text) except yaml.error.YAMLError: pass # now json try: return json.loads(code.text) except ValueError: pass # None == no metadata def run_os_apply_config(metadata, element_dir, output_dir): template_dir = os.path.join(element_dir, 'os-apply-config') if not os.path.isdir(template_dir): template_dir = os.path.join(element_dir, 'os-config-applier') if not os.path.isdir(template_dir): print('WARNING: %s has metadata in README.md but does not have a ' 'template directory' % element_dir) return with tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile() as md: md.write(json.dumps(metadata)) md.flush() args = ['os-apply-config', '-o', output_dir, '-m', md.name, '-t', template_dir] try: subprocess.check_call(args) except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e: print("----v-Metadata-v----") print(json.dumps(metadata)) print("----^-Metadata-^----") raise RuntimeError(str(e)) def main(argv): opts = get_opts(argv) try: if not opts.output_dir: opts.output_dir = tempfile.mkdtemp(prefix='tripleo-test.') element_dir = find_element(opts.element) metadata = extract_metadata(element_dir) if metadata: run_os_apply_config(metadata, element_dir, opts.output_dir) else: print("INFO: No metadata for %s" % (opts.element)) return 0 finally: if opts.cleanup_output: if os.path.isdir(opts.output_dir): shutil.rmtree(opts.output_dir) if __name__ == '__main__': try: sys.exit(main(sys.argv)) except RuntimeError as e: print("ERROR: %s" % (e)) sys.exit(1) # find example Metadata in README.md # extract example Metadata to json # run os-apply-config with # - template dir set to element's os-config-applier or os-apply-config dir # - metadata source == extracted metadata # - output set to requested output dir # if element has os-apply-config.expected dir, diff with that

commit_message:
Add services and useful options to samples/localrc

Add more options to samples/localrc with options to
enable the different services of development components
Added other few useful options as well.

Change-Id: I68136b25b9ea5e636e6a034b77f9586b62fdb5fd

commit_message:
Ensure posted size is compared with remote size and kills if different

This patch ensures the posted size is compared with downloaded imag
size when using --copy-from and kills the image if size differs
(behaving consistently with uploads from posted data).

Also fixes a few tests succeeding because of previous incorrect
behaviour which was assuming image size being the value posted and not
the value calculated from image data.

Change-Id: I08cef2143a5963c3f3c3412208cf3376299f2231
Close-Bug: 1256593

deleted_lines: image_meta['size'] = image_size or image_meta['size']

commit_message:
Update Lockutils from oslo

In future patch will be used oslo module test_migrations.py with updated
lockutils function, therefore as a first step we must update lockutils
module.

Patch is needed for Blueprint: db-sync-models-with-migrations

Dependences: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/50920/ (should be reviewed)

Change-Id: I794e2f22cc891ffeaeb95c535577997eca7cce48

commit_message:
Replaces assertEqual with assertTrue and assertFalse

In order to improve coding practices and be aligned to a standard,
self.assertEqual(...,True) statements where replaced with
self.assertTrue and self.assertFalse.

Change-Id: I190e2120fbf6d3fd33be98a2cf49faac19af0ea6
Closes-Bug: #1230127

commit_message:
Implement adopt-stack

Create a stack using already existing resources
(resources that were abandoned with abandon-stack operation)

Blueprint adopt-stack
Change-Id: I1cb3fd55de378b9d500cc6b690a41369a2fd76ae
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/07/57707/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import jsonclass ResourceAdoptTest(HeatTestCase): def setUp(self): super(ResourceAdoptTest, self).setUp() utils.setup_dummy_db() resource._register_class('GenericResourceType', generic_rsrc.GenericResource) def test_adopt_resource_success(self): adopt_data = '''{ "action": "CREATE", "status": "COMPLETE", "name": "my-test-stack-name", "resources": { "foo": { "status": "COMPLETE", "name": "foo", "resource_data": {}, "metadata": {}, "resource_id": "test-res-id", "action": "CREATE", "type": "GenericResourceType" } } }''' tmpl = template.Template({ 'Resources': { 'foo': {'Type': 'GenericResourceType'}, } }) self.stack = parser.Stack(utils.dummy_context(), 'test_stack', tmpl, stack_id=uuidutils.generate_uuid(), adopt_stack_data=json.loads(adopt_data)) rname = 'foo' res = self.stack['foo'] create = scheduler.TaskRunner(res.create) create() self.assertEqual((res.CREATE, res.COMPLETE), res.state) def test_adopt_resource_failure(self): adopt_data = '''{ "action": "CREATE", "status": "COMPLETE", "name": "my-test-stack-name", "resources": {} }''' tmpl = template.Template({ 'Resources': { 'foo': {'Type': 'GenericResourceType'}, } }) self.stack = parser.Stack(utils.dummy_context(), 'test_stack', tmpl, stack_id=uuidutils.generate_uuid(), adopt_stack_data=json.loads(adopt_data)) rname = 'foo' res = self.stack['foo'] create = scheduler.TaskRunner(res.create) self.assertRaises(exception.ResourceFailure, create) self.assertEqual((res.ADOPT, res.FAILED), res.state)

subject: Allow nova-manage to set disabled reason
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-10-30 17:51:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/6beb191213e266918b68ffa2f4eaa306c9e0f88e', 'message': "Allow nova-manage to set disabled reason

Via nova-manage, one can disable a service.  However, there's not a way
to set the disabled reason.  Add that!

Also, when doing a 'service list', if the service is disabled and
there's a reason, print it.

DocImpact

For docs:

One may now do:

nova-manage service disable host binary <reason>
or:
nova-manage service disable --reason <reason> host binary

For backwards compatibility, the reason is optional.

nova-manage service list adds a 'Disabled_Reason' column at the end.
It'll only print something if the service is disabled and there's a
reason present in the DB.

Change-Id: I362987730f557c09006f71618b29ac8c0d72ded1

commit_message:
Allow nova-manage to set disabled reason

Via nova-manage, one can disable a service.  However, there's not a way
to set the disabled reason.  Add that!

Also, when doing a 'service list', if the service is disabled and
there's a reason, print it.

DocImpact

For docs:

One may now do:

nova-manage service disable host binary <reason>
or:
nova-manage service disable --reason <reason> host binary

For backwards compatibility, the reason is optional.

nova-manage service list adds a 'Disabled_Reason' column at the end.
It'll only print something if the service is disabled and there's a
reason present in the DB.

Change-Id: I362987730f557c09006f71618b29ac8c0d72ded1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/97/54597/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: print_format = "%-16s %-36s %-16s %-10s %-5s %-10s %s" _('Updated_At'), _('Disabled_Reason'))) svc['updated_at'], (active == 'disabled' and svc['disabled_reason']) or '')) @args('--reason', metavar='<reason>', default=None, help='Reason') def disable(self, host, service, reason=None): """Mark a service as disabled.""" db.service_update(ctxt, svc['id'], {'disabled': True, 'disabled_reason': reason})
deleted_lines: print_format = "%-16s %-36s %-16s %-10s %-5s %-10s" _('Updated_At'))) svc['updated_at'])) def disable(self, host, service): """Disable scheduling for a service.""" db.service_update(ctxt, svc['id'], {'disabled': True})

commit_message:
Make the trusted_filter's cache to be global variable

The cache in trusted_filter does not work because a new instance of
TrustedFilter is made each time, which creates it's own cache.
This means that each time a new instance is scheduled, the TrustedFilter
will query the attestation service for all hosts - which is a very slow
operation.

Closes-Bug: 1223450
Change-Id: I58feb727e5d3ac59e04ce07b3326d30e08ff2696
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/73/54073/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: self.caches = ComputeAttestationCache()

commit_message:
handle multiple directories in fixup_stuff.sh

When echo /*, we may have multiple entries.
If so, die with error,instead of blinding assumping

Change-Id: I6a778192b3f352d4a603a8fe7102c9511612eb4f

commit_message:
Implements Cross Service Unified Request id

The correlation_id that is generated by the oslo-incubator
middleware is added to the RequestContext and is logged along
with the request_id, to enable more effective debugging
of requests that span multiple services.

Change-Id: I26e288ac3425b609863d40c0c9da51ae3f04effb
Implements: blueprint cross-service-request-id

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2013-12-05 20:34:33.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_properties.py', 'heat/engine/properties.py', 'heat/tests/test_resource.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/76108a90e202ff426f223f0c61e4824da9d2fdb6', 'message': 'Support typed schemas for template-from-resource

This fixes an issue where it was assumed that the schema
was in the legacy dict format.

This change now only attempts to may the Type from property schema
to parameter. Other values like constraints are not now converted.

This could be added back in the future, possibly at the same time
as this is converted to generating a HOT template.

Tests which allow Map->Map->Schema schemas have been changed to
be Map->Schema, since there are zero resources that implement
Map->Map->Schema schemas (there are many resources which implement

Change-Id: I839848b1852bb446d87674fc6754cc3c2716cb93
Closes-Bug: #1256191
'}]
commit_message:
Support typed schemas for template-from-resource

This fixes an issue where it was assumed that the schema
was in the legacy dict format.

This change now only attempts to may the Type from property schema
to parameter. Other values like constraints are not now converted.

This could be added back in the future, possibly at the same time
as this is converted to generating a HOT template.

Tests which allow Map->Map->Schema schemas have been changed to
be Map->Schema, since there are zero resources that implement
Map->Map->Schema schemas (there are many resources which implement
List->Map->Schema, and this continues to work).

Change-Id: I839848b1852bb446d87674fc6754cc3c2716cb93
Closes-Bug: #1256191
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/19/59119/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: schema = Schema.from_legacy(schema) if not schema.implemented: if schema.type == LIST: elif schema.type == MAP: params[path] = { parameters.TYPE: schema.type } if schema.description: params[path][parameters.DESCRIPTION] = schema.description
deleted_lines: if schema.get('Implemented') is False: if schema[TYPE] == LIST: elif schema[TYPE] == MAP: for prop in schema.keys(): if prop not in parameters.PARAMETER_KEYS and prop in schema: del schema[prop] params[path] = schema

commit_message:
Switch create volume commands to Taskflow 0.1.1

- Old TaskFlow code was removed from Cinder.

- TaskFlow 0.1.1 was added to Cinder requirements.

- Create volume flows for volume.api, volume.manager and
  scheduler.manager were updated to use taskFlow 0.1.1

Partially implements: blueprint create-volume-flow
Change-Id: Idbac8d001436f02978b366fbb3205ce84c847267

subject: Bring obj server unit tests to > 98%
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-11 22:27:16.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/server.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_server.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/d26e8b25a7e5e4e69208bcb86208371f6d569a7c', 'message': 'Bring obj server unit tests to > 98%

This set of changes attempts to bring the unit test coverage to over
98% for the object server module.

Two changes to the object server are made with this patch:

1. The try/except block around diskfile.write_metadata() was removed
   at the end of the POST method

The write_metadata() method of the DiskFile module does not raise
either the DiskFileNotExist or DiskFileQuarantined exceptions on that
code path.

2. The conditional container_update() call was removed at the end of
   the PUT method

The container_update() calls is performed when a new object is created
or when an exist object is updated. Since we already report old
timestamps as 409s (Conflict) we always perform the update.

We also fix an existing test to clear the hash prefix so that it can
actually detect the async pending pickle file creation for a failure
mode.

Change-Id: I71ec9dcf7c0ac86e56aa0f06993d501fdfa22d5b
'}]
commit_message:
Bring obj server unit tests to > 98%

This set of changes attempts to bring the unit test coverage to over
98% for the object server module.

Two changes to the object server are made with this patch:

1. The try/except block around diskfile.write_metadata() was removed
   at the end of the POST method

The write_metadata() method of the DiskFile module does not raise
either the DiskFileNotExist or DiskFileQuarantined exceptions on that
code path.

2. The conditional container_update() call was removed at the end of
   the PUT method

The container_update() calls is performed when a new object is created
or when an exist object is updated. Since we already report old
timestamps as 409s (Conflict) we always perform the update.

We also fix an existing test to clear the hash prefix so that it can
actually detect the async pending pickle file creation for a failure
mode.

Change-Id: I71ec9dcf7c0ac86e56aa0f06993d501fdfa22d5b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/87/61587/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

the error:
error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

Change-Id: I022214b13ca3fd155739ba50c21814ef3a9a5502

commit_message:
Pin Sphinx to <1.2

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

  error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

See: http://bugs.python.org/issue19570
and: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/pull-request/193/builddoc-shouldnt-fail-on-unicode-paths/diff

Change-Id: I80e336ca2d5436188bcf89a03bb006d3c4767e61

commit_message:
Encode exception on ceilometer-client for UnicodeDecodeError

Current ceilometer client did not handle output exception which
is encoded, this patch implements the shell encoding for exception
output.

Change-Id: I3cddb277868e39765eccd68dc256f07e15a4207b

commit_message:
Fixes documentation building

 - Adds the ability to build docs using tox
 - Fixes autodoc generation

A Sphinx extension is introduced in the commit to facilitate building
the API documentation. This extension should be removed when
bug 1260495 is fixed.

Change-Id: Ibf5e5403cb7d3e67947c87b2828b64a56a11fc30

commit_message:
Make sure report_interval is less than service_down_time

If service_down_time is less than report_interval, services will
routinely be considered down, because they report in too rarely.
Add check for service_down_time vs report_interval, if report_interval
is larger than service_down_time, automatically change
service_down_time to be report_interval * 2.5

DocImpact

Closes bug #1255685

Change-Id: I9b291669ea201321b03a48d2a132810f3bace2dc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/60/60760/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.basic_config_check() def basic_config_check(self): """Perform basic config checks before starting processing.""" # Make sure report interval is less than service down time report_interval = self.report_interval if report_interval is None: report_interval = CONF.report_interval if CONF.service_down_time < report_interval: LOG.error(_('Report interval must be less than ' 'service down time. Current config: ' '<service_down_time: %s, report_interval: %s>'), CONF.service_down_time, report_interval) sys.exit(1)

commit_message:
Support neutron configuration

Since in OpenStack Havana release the Quantum project was renamed to the
Neutron, for the cookbooks we also need do the same things to support
the Neutron. I do the %s/Quantum/Neutron/g in all the files under
cookbook-openstack-netwrok. It will effect other cookbooks:
openstack-compute, openstack-ops-database which should be covered in
others patches.

Implemented: blueprint neutron-support

Change-Id: I59f3f2d8dfad678f70b97d4cbc4e10dfa163e9b2

commit_message:
Support neutron configuration

After we have havana branch, I search and replace all the quantum with
neturon to support neutron configuraton.
The related patch on cookbook-openstack-network is:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/58217/

Implemented: blueprint neutron-support
